t: Psalm 44
Former Deliverances and Present Troubles.
For the choir director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah.
O*pn God, we have heard with our ears, Our*ln fathers have told us The*ln work that You did in their days, In*ln the days of old.
You*ln with Your own hand drove out the nations; Then*ln You planted them; You*ln afflicted the peoples, Then*ln You spread them abroad.
For*ln by their own sword they did not possess the land, And*ln their own arm did not save them, But*ln Your right hand and Your arm and the light of Your presence, For*ln You favored them.
You*ln are my King, O God; Command*ln victories for Jacob.
Through*ln You we will push back our adversaries; Through*ln Your name we will trample down those who rise up against us.
For*ln I will not trust in my bow, Nor*ln will my sword save me.
But*ln You have saved us from our adversaries, And*ln You have put to shame those who hate us.
In*ln God we have boasted all day long, And*ln we will give thanks to Your name forever. Selah.
Yet*ln You have rejected us*i and brought us to dishonor, And*ln do not go out with our armies.
You*ln cause us to turn back from the adversary; And*ln those who hate us have taken spoil for themselves.
You*ln give us as sheep to be eaten And*ln have scattered us among the nations.
You*ln sell Your people cheaply, And*ln have not profited by their sale.
You*ln make us a reproach to our neighbors, A*ln scoffing and a derision to those around us.
You*ln make us a byword among the nations, A*ln laughingstock among the peoples.
All*ln day long my dishonor is before me And*ln my humiliation has overwhelmed me,
Because*ln of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, Because*ln of the presence of the enemy and the avenger.
All*ln this has come upon us, but we have not forgotten You, And*ln we have not dealt falsely with Your covenant.
Our*ln heart has not turned back, And*ln our steps have not deviated from Your way,
Yet*ln You have crushed us in a place of jackals And*ln covered us with the shadow of death.
If*ln we had forgotten the name of our God Or*ln extended our hands to a strange god,
Would*ln not God find this out? For*ln He knows the secrets of the heart.
But*ln for Your sake we are killed all day long; We*ln are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
Arouse*ln Yourself, why do You sleep, O Lord? Awake,*ln do not reject us forever.
Why*ln do You hide Your face And*iln forget our affliction and our oppression?
For*ln our soul has sunk down into the dust; Our*ln body cleaves to the earth.
Rise*ln up, be our help, And*ln redeem us for the sake of Your lovingkindness.
